clinical_study.brief_title: Value of Anorectal Manometry Before Ileo- or Sigmoidostomy Closure After Rectal Resection
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Multi-center Evaluation of the Value of Anorectal Manometry Before Closure of Protective Ileostomy or Sigmoidostomy After Rectal Resection in Patients With Rectal Carcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: German Society for Neurogastroenterology and Motility

clinical_study.source: German Society for Neurogastroenterology and Motility

brief_summary.textblock:
Background: High prevalence of fecal incontinence after rectal resection in patients with rectal carcinoma.
Hypothesis: Anorectal manometry done before ileostomy or sigmoidostomy closure can predict fecal incontinence.
Methods: Anorectal manometry before, 1 month and 6 month after closure. Anorectal endosonography before and 1 month after closure. Prediction of postoperative incontinence by the surgeon (digital sphincter examination). Visual analog scales for continence, subjective success of operation, and global well being; Wexner and Vaizey incontinence score; Parks incontinence classification; Rockwood fecal incontinence quality of life score; each before, 1 and 6 month after closure.

primary_outcome.measure: predictive value of preoperative anorectal manometry for postoperative fecal incontinence
primary_outcome.description: Anorectal manometry is done preoperatively. Fecal incontinence is determined at 6 month postoperatively. Analysis of correlation between preoperative manometry parameter and incidence of postoperative fecal incontinence.

secondary_outcome.measure: fecal incontinence in patients with/without neoadjuvant radiochemotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the percentage of patients with postoperative fecal incontinence after rectal resection in patients with or without neoadjuvant radiochemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: predictive value of the surgeon`s preoperative evaluation
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical evaluation of the patient preoperatively with estimation (written statement) about postoperative continence/incontinence. Fecal incontinence is determined at 6 month postoperatively. Analysis of correlation between the surgeonsÂ´ predictions and the incidence of postoperative fecal incontinence

other_outcome.measure: prediction of postoperative fecal incontinence by the score of Stadelmaier and Matzel (Score =18.230 - 0.94x anastomotic level - 0.18 x resting pressure + 3.72 x radiochemotherapy (done 1, not done 0)
other_outcome.description: Analysis of correlation between the preoperatively predicted Wexner score and the observed Wexner score six month postoperative.

study_pop.textblock: all patients operated for rectal carcinoma in three German centers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients planned for ileo- or sigmoidostomy closure after rectal resection for rectal carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- preoperative incontinence for solid stool
- dementia
- pregnancy
- latex allergy
